text: Al-Ittihad Sport Club (), is an Iraqi multi-sport club based in Al-Ashar, Basra. ==History== Al-Ittihad was founded in 1937, is third sport club that become established in Iraq after Al-Tayaran and Al-Minaa.Iraq Clubs- Foundation Dates In the 1940s, the club was receiving direct support from Prince Abd al-Ilah. Prince Abd al-Ilah's encouragement was the first motive for the club's activity, as he visited Basra on every occasion, he came to the stadium to enjoy one of the football matches that the club was running. He also donated a silver cup to the football club bearing his name in 1947, and on April 22, 1949 the prince spent an entire day in the club's hospitality to supervise himself the activities of the club teams. Since 1976 season the club was playing in the Iraqi LeagueHistory of Iraqi league, 1976–77 (in Arabic) in three seasons,History of Iraqi league, 1977–78 (in Arabic) then relegated Iraq Division One in 1979 season.History of Iraqi league, 1978–79 (in Arabic) The club played in Iraq Division one and won this championship in 1980–81 season and promoted in the league again and played 1981–82 season in league.History of Iraqi league, 1981–82 (in Arabic) ==Honours== ===National=== *Iraq Division One **Winners (1): 1980–81 ===Regional=== *Iraq FA Basra League (top tier) **Runners-up (1): 1949–50 ==References== ==External links== * Team's profile on Goalzz.com * Basra Clubs Union * Hanna Al-Sheikh Cup * Al-Minaa Club: Sailors of south Category:Football clubs in Iraq Category:Association football clubs established in 1937 Category:Football clubs in Basra Category:Sport in Basra Category:Basra
title: Al-Ittihad SC (Basra)
